abstract: Cinven and Warburg Pincus are selling their remaining stakes in the Dutch cable company Ziggo for up to a combined 880 million euros, or $1.1 billion.
snippet: Cinven and Warburg Pincus are selling their remaining stakes in the Dutch cable company Ziggo for up to a combined 880 million euros, or $1.1 billion.
lead_paragraph: LONDON – The private equity firms Cinven and Warburg Pincus are selling their remaining stakes in the Dutch cable company Ziggo for up to a combined 880 million euros, or $1.1 billion.

headline.main: Private Equity Firms Sell Stake in Ziggo for $1.1 Billion
